title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
author: Stephen Hawking
quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the universe. That makes us something very special.
description: Hawking's final gift to humanity—a brilliant mind's last thoughts on existence, artificial intelligence, and whether we're alone. Reading this feels like having a conversation with one of history's greatest thinkers about the questions that keep you awake at night.

title: The Universe in a Nutshell
author: Stephen Hawking
description: A mind-bending sequel that somehow makes quantum mechanics and relativity feel accessible. Hawking's gift for turning the impossible into the inevitable shines here—you'll finish this book feeling like you've glimpsed the universe's deepest secrets through the eyes of a genius.

title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
quote: My goal is simple. It is a complete understanding of the universe, why it is as it is and why it exists at all.
description: The book that made cosmology cool and turned Stephen Hawking into a household name. This isn't just science—it's philosophy disguised as physics. Every page challenges you to think bigger about time, space, and your place in the cosmic story.

title: IT
author: Stephen King
quote: Maybe there aren't any such things as good friends or bad friends—maybe there are just friends, people who stand by you when you're hurt and who help you feel not so lonely.
description: Disguised as a monster story, this is actually King's masterpiece about childhood, memory, and the terrible things we survive. IT isn't just about a clown—it's about the monsters we face growing up and the friends who help us face them. Brutal, beautiful, and unforgettable.

title: The Stand
author: Stephen King
quote: The world had teeth and it could bite you with them anytime it wanted.
description: King's sprawling epic about what happens when civilization crumbles and we're forced to choose sides between good and evil. More than a plague story—it's a meditation on human nature, faith, and whether we're worth saving. The characters will haunt you long after the last page.

title: Pet Sematary
author: Stephen King
quote: Grief was the celebration of love, that was what they never told you. Grief and love are conjoined, you don't get one without the other.
description: King's most disturbing work because it taps into the one fear every parent carries—what we'd do to bring back what we've lost. This isn't horror for horror's sake; it's a devastating exploration of love, loss, and the terrible choices grief makes us consider.

author: George Orwell
quote: The Party told you to reject the evidence of your eyes and ears. It was their final, most essential command.
description: The most terrifying book ever written because it feels less like fiction every year. Orwell didn't just predict the future—he gave us the vocabulary to understand it. Every time you hear 'alternative facts' or 'fake news,' you're living in Winston Smith's world.

title: Continuous Discovery Habits: Discover Products that Create Customer Value and Business Value
author: Teresa Torres
genre: Product Management, UX Research, Business Strategy
quote: The goal of discovery is not to prove that we are right, but to quickly discover when we are wrong.
description: The product management book I wish I'd had years ago. Torres doesn't just tell you what to do—she shows you how to build a sustainable practice of actually understanding your customers. It's the difference between guessing what people want and knowing what they need.

title: Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
author: James Clear
quote: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.
description: The most practical self-help book I've ever read. Clear doesn't promise overnight transformation—instead, he shows you how tiny changes compound into remarkable results. This book doesn't just change how you think about habits; it changes how you think about change itself.

title: The Mom Test: How to talk to customers & learn if your business is a good idea when everyone is lying to you
author: Rob Fitzpatrick
quote: The Mom Test is a set of simple rules for crafting good questions that even your mom can't lie to you about.
description: The brutally honest guide that destroys every comfortable lie entrepreneurs tell themselves about customer validation. Fitzpatrick strips away the politeness and teaches you how to have conversations that actually matter. This book will make you cringe at every 'great idea!' you've received—and show you how to find the truth instead.

title: Homo Deus: A Brief History of Tomorrow
author: Yuval Noah Harari
quote: We are probably one of the last generations of homo sapiens. Within a century or two, Earth will be dominated by entities that are more different from us than we are different from Neanderthals.
description: Harari's follow-up to Sapiens is both exhilarating and terrifying—a roadmap to humanity's potential future that reads like science fiction but feels inevitable. He forces you to confront uncomfortable questions about consciousness, free will, and whether we're creating our successors. Brilliant, unsettling, and impossible to ignore.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
quote: We study history not to predict the future, but to free ourselves of the past and imagine alternative destinies.
description: The book that changes everything you think you know about human civilization. Harari weaves together history, biology, and philosophy to tell the story of how we went from insignificant apes to rulers of the planet. Reading this feels like seeing the human story from space—suddenly everything makes sense, and nothing looks the same.

title: The Master Algorithm: How the Quest for the Ultimate Learning Machine Will Remake Our World
author: Pedro Domingos
genre: Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Popular science
quote: Machine learning is something new under the sun: a technology that builds itself.
description: Domingos makes the complex world of machine learning accessible without dumbing it down. This isn't just about algorithms—it's about the future of human knowledge itself. He shows you how the quest for the ultimate learning machine is reshaping everything from medicine to politics. Essential reading for understanding the AI revolution happening around us.

title: Light in the Darkness: Black Holes, the Universe and Us
author: Heino Falcke
quote: We are part of the universe trying to understand itself.
description: Written by one of the scientists who gave us the first image of a black hole, this is both a scientific memoir and a profound meditation on our place in the cosmos. Falcke weaves together cutting-edge astrophysics with philosophy and spirituality in a way that feels natural, not forced. Reading this is like getting a personal tour of the universe from someone who's dedicated their life to unveiling its secrets.

title: The Little Book of Cosmology
author: Lyman Page
quote: The universe is not only stranger than we imagine, it is stranger than we can imagine.
description: Don't let the 'little' in the title fool you—Page packs an enormous amount of cosmic insight into a compact, readable format. This is cosmology for people who want to understand the big picture without getting lost in the mathematics. Perfect for wrapping your head around dark matter, cosmic inflation, and the fundamental questions about our universe's past and future.
